awd_titl_txt: Stratification and Buoyancy Reversal in Buoyant Flows
awd_abstract_narration: Laboratory experiments will be used to measure the                         entrainment and mixing characteristics of thermals and plumes in                a stratified environment, including the influence of simulated                  evaporative cooling.  The experiments will be performed in a                    large tank, using fluorescent and regular ph indicators and acid-               base reactions to optically determine mixing location and amount.               Characterization of the detrained fluid and the mixing near an                  inversion will also be focal points of the research.  Earlier                   work has established both the techniques and the mixing behavior                in the absence of stratification.  This work would help to                      address important questions in cloud physics by providing a                     strong foundation of fundamental results for the simplest,                      idealized cases.//
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
